titleStmt.title: Propositions for peace by an union of interests, or A memento to the Kings party; being the present quarrell stated, and severall effectuall remedies propounded, for universall satisfaction of all parties, that desire a speedy composure, a lasting peace, and a prevention of the destroying war, and approaching desolation, which now threaten the nation. Read, judge, prosecute.

notesStmt.note: Reproductions of the originals in the British Library.
